creator: Mark_Despain@McAfee.com
text:
I tried submitted an question to the user mailing list regarding support for RFC 2817, but I didn't get any replies.  So, I figure I'll try an enhancement request since researching the topic hinted that it is not supported.

Here is a link to the RFC - http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2817.txt

Here is info that I included within my inquiry to the mailing list.

* This only information I’ve been able to find regarding RFC 2817 and Tomcat is at the link below.  It is from last August and more or less states that it is not supported.  However, it doesn’t say anything about a possible enhancement.
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/tomcat-users/200601.mbox/%3Cdr48si$s20$1@sea.gmane.org%3E

* I also found this page, which cites a couple Apache Java projects that support RFC 2817.  Any chance this could be incorporated into Tomcat?
http://projects.apache.org/indexes/standards.html
*** This bug has been confirmed by popular vote. ***
creator: markt@apache.org

text: Tomcat relies on JSSE to provide the bulk of the SSL implementation. Until JSSE supports RFC 2817 for http then this is going to remain a WONTFIX.
creator: markt@apache.org
